line.words: Jane e suo fratello al mare

subtitle.line: Jane og Tom ved havet
Jane and Tom at the seaside
Jane and Tom at the seaside
Janet en Tom aan zee

line.words: Jane e suo fratello, Tom, stanno con loro nonna che abita al mare.

subtitle.line: Jane og hendes bror, Tom, er på besøg hos deres bedstemor, der bor ved havet.
Jane and her brother, Tom, are staying with their Grandma who lives by the sea.
Jane and her brother, Tom, are staying with their Grandma who lives by the sea.
Janet en haar broer Tom zijn bij oma, die aan zee woont.

line.words: Lunedi Jane dice a nonna, “Per favore, possiamo andare alla spiaggia, oggi?” “No, non oggi” dice nonna. “È molto affollata e la spiaggia è sporca e pietrosa.”

subtitle.line: Om mandagen siger Jane til bedstemor: “Kan vi ikke godt tage til stranden i dag?””Ikke i dag”, siger bedstemor. ”Der er overfyldt, og stranden er beskidt og fuld af sten.”
On Monday, Jane says to Grandma, “Please, can we go to the beach today?” “Not today,” says Grandma. “It is very crowded and the beach is dirty and pebbly.”
On Monday, Jane says to Grandma, “Please, can we go to the beach today?” “Not today,” says Grandma. “It is very crowded and the beach is dirty and pebbly.”
Op maandag zegt Janet tegen oma,“Mogen we vandaag naar het strand?”“Vandaag niet,” zegt oma. “Het is er heel druk en het strand is vies en vol met kiezels.”

line.words: Martedi Tom dice a nonna, “Per favore, possiamo andare alla spiaggia oggi?” “No, non oggi” dice nonna. “È molto nuvoloso e la scogliera è pericolosa. La spiaggia è vuota.”

subtitle.line: Om tirsdagen siger Tom til bedstemor: “Kan vi ikke godt tage til stranden i dag?” ”Ikke i dag”, siger bedstemor. ”Det er overskyet, og klippen er farlig. Der er ingen på stranden.”
On Tuesday, Tom says to Grandma, “Please, can we go to the beach today?” “Not today,” says Grandma. “It is cloudy and the cliff is dangerous. The beach is empty.”
On Tuesday, Tom says to Grandma, “Please, can we go to the beach today?” “Not today,” says Grandma. “It is cloudy and the cliff is dangerous. The beach is empty.”
Op dinsdag vraagt Tom aan oma “Mogen we vandaag naar het strand?” “Vandaag niet,” zegt oma. “Het is bewolkt en de klif is gevaarlijk. Het strand is leeg.”

line.words: Mercoledi Jane e Tom dicono alla nonna, “Per favore, possiamo andare alla spiaggia oggi?” “Si” dice nonna. “Fa bel tempo e il cielo è blu. Si può fare il bagno e la sabbia è gialla e pulita.”

subtitle.line: Om onsdagen siger Jane og Tom til deres bedstemor: “Kan vi ikke godt tage til stranden i dag?””Jo”, siger bedstemor. ”Det er solskin, og himlen er blå. Havet er sikkert, og sandet er gult og rent.”
On Wednesday, Jane and Tom say to their Grandma, “Please, can we go to the beach today?”“Yes,” says Grandma. “It is sunny and the sky is blue. The sea is safe and the sand is yellow and clean.”
On Wednesday, Jane and Tom say to their Grandma, “Please, can we go to the beach today?”“Yes,” says Grandma. “It is sunny and the sky is blue. The sea is safe and the sand is yellow and clean.”
Op woensdag zeggen Janet en Tom tegen hun oma “Mogen we vandaag naar het strand?”“Ja,” zegt oma. “Het is lekker weer en de lucht is blauw. De zee is veilig en het zand is geel en schoon.”

line.words: La spiaggia è bella. Jane, Tom e nonna si sedono sotto un ombrello verde su i loro asciugamani. Portano i cappelli chiaro azzurri e hanno un buon picnic in un cestino.

subtitle.line: Stranden er smuk. Jane, Tom og bedstemor sidder under en grøn parasol på deres håndklæder. De har lyseblå hatte på, og de har en dejlig madpakke i en kurv.
“Cosa vedi?” chiede nonna. Jane osserva il mare e dice “Una piccola barca con una vela rossa sta scivolando e c’è un grande vaporetto.
“Cosa vedi?” chiede nonna. Jane osserva il mare e dice “Una piccola barca con una vela rossa sta scivolando e c’è un grande vaporetto.
Het strand is prachtig. Janet, Tom en oma zitten onder een groene parasol op hun strandlakens. Ze dragen lichtblauwe hoedjes en ze hebben een mooie picknickmand.

line.words: “Cosa vedi?” chiede nonna. Jane osserva il mare e dice “Una piccola barca con una vela rossa sta scivolando e c’è un grande vaporetto.

subtitle.line: “Hvad kan du se?” spørger bedstemor. Jane kigger ud over havet og siger: ”En lille båd med et rødt sejl og en stor damper.”
“What can you see?” asks Grandma.Jane looks at the sea and says, “A small boat with a red sail is gliding along and there is a big steamer.”
“What can you see?” asks Grandma.Jane looks at the sea and says, “A small boat with a red sail is gliding along and there is a big steamer.”
“Wat zie jij?” vraagt oma.Janet kijkt naar de zee en zegt “Een kleine boot met een rood zeil vaart voorbij en er is een grote stoomboot.”

line.words: “Cosa vedi?” chiede nonna. Tom dice “ Un cane marrone che sta guardando una piccola ragazza che dorme sulla spiaggia sabbiosa.”

subtitle.line: “Hvad kan du se?” spørger bedstemor. Tom siger: ”En brun hund kigger på en lille pige, der sover på sandstranden.”
“What can you see?” asks Grandma.Tom says, “A brown dog is watching a little girl sleeping on the sandy beach.”
“What can you see?” asks Grandma.Tom says, “A brown dog is watching a little girl sleeping on the sandy beach.”
“Wat zie jij?” vraagt oma.Tom zegt “Een bruine hond kijkt naar een klein meisje terwijl ze slaapt op het zandstrand.”

line.words: “Cosa sta facendo la donna?” chiede nonna. “Si spazzola i capelli” dice Jane.

subtitle.line: “Hvad laver damen?” spørger bedstemor. ”Hun børster håret”, siger Jane.
“What is the woman doing?” asksGrandma. “She is brushing her hair,” says Jane.
“What is the woman doing?” asksGrandma. “She is brushing her hair,” says Jane.
“Wat doet die vrouw?” vraagt oma. “Ze borstelt haar haren”, zegt Janet.

line.words: “Cosa sta facendo l’uomo?” chiede nonna. “Sta camminando lungo la baia”, dice Tom.

subtitle.line: “Hvad laver manden?” spørger bedstemor. ”Han går rundt om bugten”, siger Tom.
“What is the man doing?” asks Grandma. “He is walking round the bay,” says Tom.
“What is the man doing?” asks Grandma. “He is walking round the bay,” says Tom.
“Wat doet die man?” vraagt oma. “Hij loopt rond bij de baai”, zegt Tom.

line.words: Passano una bella giornata. Jane e Tom nuotano nel mare azzurro. Trovano delle conchiglie bianche in una grotta e salgono le roccie. Poi tornano a casa, stanchi ma felici.

subtitle.line: De har en dejlig dag. Jane og Tom svømmer i det blå hav. De finder nogle hvide skaller i en hule og klatrer i nogle klipper. Så tager de alle hjem, trætte men glade.
They have a lovely day. Jane and Tom swim in the blue sea. They find some white shells in a cave and climb some rocks. Then they all go home, tired but happy.
They have a lovely day. Jane and Tom swim in the blue sea. They find some white shells in a cave and climb some rocks. Then they all go home, tired but happy.
Ze hebben een leuke dag. Janet en Tom zwemmen in de blauwe zee. Ze vinden witte schelpen in een grot en klimmen op rotsen. Daarna gaan ze naar huis, moe maar voldaan.
